lines.text: Well, Tex, I've had an idea for a long time.
Why, Spud, I've never suspected you of having an idea.

[to his teammates]
Spud wants to be a cowpuncher. He's gone to night school at the movies and he's learned all about being a cowboy and now he wants to ride 'em high, wide and handsome with a loud, "Whoopee!"
[Spud is riding a horse for the first time]
Well, how are you makin' out?
I've got blisters where I've never had blisters before.
Aw, keep your chin up.
It ain't my chin that's botherin' me. That horse trader sold me a rock crusher instead of a cayuse.
I reckon I owe you a debt of gratitude whether I like it or not.
Why, Lem, what quarrel have you got with me?
I've got a quarrel with any one by the name of Fletcher!
You either said too much or not enough. Go on.
I've heard of razorback hogs before, but I've never heard of razorback horses.
Spud, we've got to be smart and the best way to out-smart the other fella is to make him think you're not smart.
Aw, that last part will be a cinch for me.
You drift into town tomorrow and don't act as if you know me no matter what happens. It's brains against beef until we can spring the fireworks in the fourth quarter.
There's a pair of these guns exactly a like. My father gave me one and he carried the other and this one has a message for whoever is responsible for what happened to him.

[to Spud]
I bet you were a hard-ridin' hombre - back in Jersey.
Sol Fletcher was the only man who could have organized the opposition against us and he's been patted in the face with a shovel.
I thought of you only as a singer, not a horseman.
Well, some singers should be horseman only.
[Spud tumbles out of the saddle after pulling his horse up sharply]
Say, do you always get off a horse thataway?
No, only when I dismount.
[Spud collects a huge payout from a slot machine]
Hey, Gus, the machine's out of order - it's paying off!
